title.narrative: Africa Programme for Peace, Phase IV

description.narrative: The APP is aimed at strengthening the African Union (AU) and selected Regional Economic Communities (RECs) within the area of peace, security and democratic governance.

participating-org.narrative: Economic Community of West African States

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: ECOWAS has improved the enabling mechanism for prevention, management and resolution of conflict
Level of implementation of ECPF plans.

target.value: Evidence of initiation of ECPF plan implementation in 80% of member states.

title.narrative: ECOWAS has observed elections in MSs and strengthened EMBs
Number of elections observed by short term observation missions (STOMs) and long term observation missions (LTOMs) respectively and Gender balance in STOMs and LTOMs

target.value: 1. Three Presidential and General elections observed; 2. Political parties / Media trained on elections and political rights in 3 MS.

actual.value:
- Burkina Faso Presidential Elections - Ghana Presidential and General Elections - Niger Presidential Elections - Côte d’Ivoire Presidential Elections
Four presidential and one General - GIZ, ECOWAS train election administrators and stakeholders on effective boundary delimitation. - ECOWAS reports that training for Political Parties, CSOs and Media in two Member States (Cote d’Ivoire, Ghana) were implemented in 2020 (one missing) – more information on the focus of training needed.

target.value: 1. Three Presidential and General elections observed; 2. Political parties / Media trained on elections and political rights in 3 MS.

actual.value: Benin presidential elections (April 1st round) Cabo Verde legislative elections (April) Niger presidential and legislative elections (January) Cabo Verde presidential elections (October) Three presidential elections observed, one legislative (Nov.2021) Training for Political Parties, CSOs, Security Forces and Media in two Member States (Benin, Cape Verde) in 2021– more information needed on the focus of training. ECOWAS conducted training of political stakeholders and had consultative engagements in the Gambia (September 2021).

target.value: 1. Three (3) Technical Experts Missions are deployed to Mali and Guinea to provide Assistance 2. Agreement over the Type and Mandate of EMB’s is fully implemented 3. Appropriation of the election calendar by EMB’s 4. Capacity building needs are identified and effectively provided to EMB’s.
1. Two Presidential elections observed (Sierra Leone and Mali) by LTOMs; 2. Political parties / Media trained on elections and political rights in 2 MS.

actual.value: No implementation due to late submission of audits which affected the disbursement schedule

title.narrative: Increased coordination, monitoring, awareness promotion and synergy towards the implementation of the ECPF at three levels; ECOWAS Directorates, Member States and CSOs

Three-year strategic Plans of Action for the ECPF are developed, adopted and implemented and ECPF-secretariat ensures that annual work plans for ECOWAS’ Focal Point Directorates, Member States and CSOs are developed and approved and the Internal Steering Committee (ISC) meet hi-annually.

actual.value: - A new Strategic Vision of the Commission was drafted, validated by regional stakeholders and adopted by the ECOWAS Heads of State and Government. The evaluation of the ECPF Plans of Action will be used to contextualize the next generation Plans of Action which is meant to be developed in early 2022. Consultation on cooperation with various Partners were held. ECOWAS Launched the Joint Analysis and Response Planning Compendium and Regional and Country Risk and Vulnerable. ECOWAS engaged with Member States and Civil Society Organisations on conflict prevention interventions ISC met bi-annually

ECPF Plans of Action 2018 – 2020 implemented in 2019 Cooperation with Partners to consolidate support for ECOWAS conflict prevention initiatives have taken place Continuous engagement with MS and CSOs on conflict prevention interventions has taken place 5. ISC meet bi-annually and 2020 work plan has been approved.

target.value: 1. 65% male and 35% female no. of staff trained; at least 20 number of member state and CSO staff participate in ECPF retreat 2. Post-training assessment shows at least 50% increase in ECPF understanding
1. 65% male and 35% female no. of staff trained; 0% number of member state and CSO staff participate in ECPF retreat 2. Post-training assessment shows 70% increase in ECPF understanding

actual.value: No implementation of funds due to late submission of audit
review and assessment not done in 2020 due to COVID but has been done in July 2021 ISC meets bi-annually ECPF focal point meetings held. Workshops w. Private sector. Conference with CSOs held

title.narrative: Preventive Diplomacy is applied in the management, resolution and peacebuilding phases of conflicts through Mediation Facilitation and International Cooperation

The capacity of mediators and facilitators, the Council of the Wise, Special Representatives and other regional mediation institutions is strengthened and backstopped by ECOWAS. Enhanced coordination, cooperation and synergy of ECOWAS efforts within the overall AU and UN security architecture with a view to resolving identified challenges facing the region.

actual.value: 2015-2019 Annual training- detailed reporting, lessons learned, and evaluation ECOWAS held Training on the World Trade Organisation (WTO) Trade Facilitation Agreement (TFA) Five-Day training Workshop for journalists and stakeholders held between the 16th and 20th of November, 2020 in Abuja Nigeria - ECOWAS Holds Regional Sensitisation Workshop on the African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) for the Private Sector - ECOWAS to facilitate the signing of bilateral agreement on combating trafficking in persons between Nigeria and Mali ECOWAS galvanises support to increase women participation in electoral processes in the region in collaboration with un office to the African Union (UNOAU). International Labour Organisation Partners ECOWAS and the Media on Accelerating Action for the Elimination of Child Labour

Capacity enhancement workshop conducted Decade of operationalisation of ECOWAS in conflict prevention conference was held Annual impact analysis was not conducted PAPS Quarterly Briefing with Ambassadors on Peace and Security

ECOWAS and UNDP: awareness training on promoting accountability for gender equality and women’s empowerment Training workshops on the use of dialogue and mediation in preventing and mitigating electoral-related disputes and conflicts for member states holding elections in 2021 (The Gambia) International Labour Organisation Partners ECOWAS and the Media on Accelerating Action for the Elimination of Child Labour Implementation of ECOWAS cross-border cooperation programme: Member States’ focal points hold discussions on free movement and regional funding mechanism June 2021 ECOWAS PAPS held a virtual meeting with members of UN Security Council, UNOWAS, and other development partners on security landscape in the region (September 2021) ECOWAS held an engagement workshop in on implementing the AU’s Kampala Convention for the Protection and Assistance of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs), UNHCR also involved (October 2021) Briefing with Ambassadors was conducted.

target.value: 1. 65% male and 35% female no. of staff trained; at least 20 number of member state and CSO staff participate in ECPF retreat 2. Post-training assessment shows at least 50% increase in ECPF understanding
1. 65% male and 35% female no. of staff trained; 0% number of member state and CSO staff participate in ECPF retreat 2. Post-training assessment shows 70% increase in ECPF understanding

actual.value: no implementation due to the late submission of audit reports
